title: Igede Wycliffe Translation (Portions)
title_vernacular: Jaabwo kaÃÅ Oholuhyeh ho odeheh ole
description: Igede is a language spoken in Lower Benue State and Cross River State, Nigeria, by 250,000 people. Igede is a tripartite referring as well to the ""people" and the "igede land" that is occupied by the Igede people.

language.name: Igede
language.area: Benue state, Oju, Otukpo, and Okpokwu LGAs; Cross River state, Ogoja LGA.
